intro: Waltheria ovata f. reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate waltheria, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, palmately lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
